did.abstract: Non-profit organization providing energy efficiency information and services to homes and businesses in Michigan. Name changed in 2009 to Michigan Energy Options. Collection includes administrative and financial files; records of grants, programs, and services; documentation of the Energy Demonstration House; records of the organizationâ€™s work with regional task forces and issue advocacy; seminar and curriculum development materials; printed brochures and newsletters; press releases and clippings; and photographs and slides of staff and volunteers, the Energy Demonstration House, and exhibits and events.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Michigan Energy Options (donor no. 10439) in September, 2010.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Urban Options records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Urban Options (as of 2009, known as Michigan Energy Options) is a non-profit community agency that provides energy and environmental information and services. Founded in 1978 in response to the energy crisis, Urban Options promotes awareness of energy efficiency measures, advocates for conservation efforts and sustainable energy policy, and provides services to increase energy efficiency in homes and businesses in Michigan. The organization's programs include residential and commercial energy audits, home weatherization, and energy-related curriculum development. Urban Options also maintains a library of books, videos, periodicals, and reference materials on a variety of environmental topics and conducts educational programs for children and adults on energy conservation, sustainable energy, composting, and ecological landscaping.

Urban Options operates an Energy and Environmental Demonstration House, located in East Lansing. The house was originally leased from the City of East Lansing in 1978 and was retrofitted by staff and volunteers through a series of workshops. In 1987, the house was moved from its original location at 135 Linden to its current location at 405 Grove Street to make room for a new parking lot for City Hall. Over the years, Urban Options and its volunteers have continued to make improvements to the house. The Energy Demonstration House uses energy efficient materials, structures, and appliances, and features exhibits on insulation, water conservation, air leakage, composting, ecological landscaping, solar energy, and recycling. A second Energy Demonstration Center, located in Marquette, is operated by the northern branch of Michigan Energy Options, formerly known as Northern Options.

scopecontent.p: The Urban Options records provide an in-depth look at the work of this non-profit energy efficiency organization from its founding in 1978 until 2002. The collection documents how Urban Options was managed as it grew and integrated new services; how programs were developed and implemented; how the organization delivered its message of energy efficiency and sustainability through publications and media outreach, and how it sought institutional and individual support for its work. The records are arranged into eight series.

The Administrative and Financial series documents the management of the organization, and includes board of directors' minutes, planning materials, financial statements, annual reports, procedure manuals, and correspondence. The bulk of the correspondence in this series consists of letters sent by Executive Director LeRoy Harvey and a smaller number sent by his successor Patrick Hudson. There are some incoming letters as well, but the majority of incoming correspondence is filed by the program or activity to which it pertains.

did.unittitle: Articles of incorporation and non-profit filings
Staff: job descriptions, resumes, staff letters
Urban Options/Northern Options emergency response plan
Urban Options volunteer orientation packet/trainer's manual

scopecontent.p: Policy and Issue Advocacy is a small series documenting Urban Options' work to increase public support and influence government policy on issues relating to sustainable energy. Subjects in this series include the Clean Energy Campaign and energy policy in East Lansing and Ingham County. Materials include policy statements, correspondence, press releases, and meeting notes and agendas.

did.unittitle: Community Energy Plan for East Lansing proposal
Energy policy, Ingham County and East Lansing

scopecontent.p: The Regional Committees and Task Forces series contains records of collaborations among Michigan energy and environmental organizations to develop energy efficiency and sustainability programs for communities in the state. Committees represented in this series include the Tri-Country Regional Energy Consortium and Earth Share of Michigan. Materials include program proposals, reports, correspondence, and meeting notes and agendas. Records of work done primarily by Urban Options staff for some of these projects can also be found in the Programs and Services series.

did.unittitle: East Lansing Community Based Economic Development workshop proposal
Michigan Energy Demonstration Centers joint project
Red Cedar River, fishing on campus ordinance
Urban Options Energy Consortium statement of qualifications

scopecontent.p: Records in the Programs and Services series document the organization's work providing energy efficiency services and demonstrating conservation methods and sustainable energy applications. This series is divided into three subseries. The largest of these, Program Files, contains program proposals, progress reports, correspondence, and meeting notes for programs offered by Urban Options, including audits of residential and commercial energy use, solar and wind energy demonstrations, composting and recycling, and green commuting options. This subseries also contains files documenting the history of the Energy Demonstration House. The Grants and Contracts subseries documents work done by Urban Options for Lansing, East Lansing, and Ingham County. The final subseries, Reference Files, contains miscellaneous reports and studies on solar energy and transportation, and information on a number of home energy audit services around the United States.

did.unittitle: Board of Water and Light, Energy Fitness visits
Photovoltaic and Wind Generator Demonstration proposal
Solar Energy Demonstration, Electric Vehicle Charging Station

City of East Lansing proposals for services
Lansing Community College Solar Applications course materials
Planning for Energy Conservation draft report

scopecontent.p: The Education series contains two subseries. Seminars and Curriculum Development includes records of workshops and seminars given by the organization on composting, ecological landscaping, solar energy, and bicycle commuting; and materials and curriculum ideas for teaching energy related topics. Additional curriculum development records can be found in the Programs and Services series. The Subject Files subseries of Education contains an assortment of information on topics such as composting, native plants, tree planting, hazardous household waste, and organic pest control.

did.unittitle: Community Energy Management: Community Energy Education Project
Project Energy for Conservation District Trainers
Waste Information Series for Educators (WISE) curriculum

scopecontent.p: Fundraising and Events is another small series. It includes documentation of Urban Options' planning for fundraising campaigns and donor appeals, as well as the organization's participation in energy fairs, Earth Day celebrations, and other public events.

The Communications series contains two subseries. Publications and Information Resources includes materials produced by Urban Options, such as newsletters, brochures, and fact sheets, and information about the organization's library and website. The Publicity subseries contains press releases and newspaper clippings about Urban Options and energy efficiency issues.

did.unittitle: Fact Sheets and Energy Fitness Tips

scopecontent.p: The final series, Audiovisual, includes photographs and slides documenting the organization, its staff and volunteers, the Energy Demonstration house, displays and exhibits, seminars and demonstrations, and meetings and events attended by Urban Options members. This series also includes two motion picture films about energy in Michigan, and a sample of thermograms (thermal images of infrared radiation) taken of residences, business, and public buildings in East Lansing as part of the Saving Energy in East Lansing program. In addition to the thermograms, there is an interpretation guide, a brief video produced by Urban Options promoting the program, and several slides and small photographic prints of thermal images.

odd.p: (includes images of homes in Haslett and Perry, MI)

did.unittitle: From Yard Waste to Yard Riches workshop
Thermogram interpretation guide and related materials

odd.p: (VHS video, approximately 5 minutes, introducing the thermogram program)
